silver_truth: On September 20, 2022, during the United Nations General Assembly, French President Emmanuel Macron delivered a speech condemning Russia's invasion of Ukraine, labeling it as a form of modern-day imperialism that harkens back to the colonial era. He argued that the invasion is dividing the world and destroying the international order. Macron criticized neutral countries for their silence, implying that their inaction equates to complicity in Russia's aggression. He urged the international community to uphold the UN charter and push Russia to cease its war efforts.

documents.title: Kemudahan antipengganasan baru di S'pura bagi perkukuh kerjasama serantau

sentences.content: SEBUAH kemudahan perkongsian perisikan baru bagi mengekang ancaman pengganasan telah dilancarkan di sini semalam.
Kemudahan Maklumat Bertindak Balas terhadap Pengganasan (CTIF) itu telah dirasmikan oleh Menteri Pertahanan, Dr Ng Eng Hen.
Dr Ng berkata ia dibuka sedang ancaman pengganasan kekal "tinggi dan semakin berubah" kerana rangkaian pengganas telah berkembang dan menjadi lebih canggih.

CTIF merupakan sebuah kemudahan berbilang hala dan agensi yang menyatukan negara-negara dengan kefahaman yang sama untuk berkongsi perisikan serta menawarkan amaran awal terhadap ancaman pengganasan di rantau ini, kata Kementerian Pertahanan (Mindef) dalam satu kenyataan.
Kebanyakan operasi kemudahan itu dirahsiakan atas sebab jaminan dan keselamatan serantau, kata Mindef.
Kementerian itu juga menambah, ia penting untuk menyelaras usaha pencegahan pengganasan dengan memanfaatkan perisikan secara kolektif serta kaedah yang dipacu oleh data.
Dalam satu pos di Facebook semalam, Dr Ng berkata kemudahan itu terletak di Changi.
Berucap di majlis itu, Dr Ng berkata ancaman pengganasan kekal tinggi, sedang rangkaian pengganas kini beroperasi dengan lebih canggih.

Sejak kemudahan itu mula beroperasi pada Januari tahun lalu, CTIF telah menghasilkan beberapa produk perisikan tepat pada masanya bersama Negara Rakan, dan membantu rantau ini terhadap usaha mencegah pengganasan secara kolektif.
Dr Ng juga telah bertemu dengan beberapa wakil Negara Rakan tersebut di majlis perasmian itu serta melahirkan penghargaan kepada mereka atas sokongan mereka yang teguh.
Inisiatif CTIF itu menjadi kenyataan hanya menerusi sumbangan yang sangat berharga oleh rakan-rakan negara, yang memaparkan "tekad kolektif" bagi menangani pengganasan, kata Dr Ng.
Beliau juga memuji kemudahan itu atas usahanya mengenal pasti betapa pantasnya penularan ideologi ekstrem di rantau ini dan telah membolehkan agensi keselamatan serantau bertindak balas.
Dr Ng turut berkata sedang sekatan perjalanan telah dilonggarkan, terdapat kemungkinan anggota pengganas asing kembali ke rantau ini.
"Kita justeru perlu menggandakan usaha mencegah pengganasan secara bersama. Dengan berkongsi apa yang kita tahu akan menggandakan pemahaman kita terhadap trend dan perkembangan serantau," kata Dr Ng.

documents.title: Ancaman pengganasan kekal 'tinggi, kian berubah' sedang rangkaian pengganas semakin berleluasa, kata Ng Eng Hen

sentences.content: SINGAPURA: Ancaman pengganasan kekal "tinggi dan kian berubah-ubah" ketika rangkaian pengganas semakin canggih dan berleluasa, kata Menteri Pertahanan Ng Eng Hen.
Dr Ng berucap di majlis perasmian bagi pembukaan Kemudahan Maklumat Bertindak Balas terhadap Pengganasan (CTIF) pada Rabu (21 Sep).

Kemudahan berbilang hala antara agensi itu menyatukan negara-negara dengan "fahaman yang sama" untuk berkongsi risikan dan memberikan amaran awal terhadap pengganasan di rantau ini, menurut Kementerian Pertahanan (MINDEF).

Meskipun kebanyakan operasi kemudahan itu kekal dirahsiakan atas sebab-sebab keselamatan serantau, MINDEF menambah bahawa ia sangat penting untuk "menyelaras" usaha menentang pengganasan dengan menggunakan kecerdasan kolektif dan kaedah yang dipacu oleh data.
Dr Ng berkata inisiatif CTIF hanya boleh dilakukan kerana sumbangan tidak ternilai oleh semua rakan kongsi yang memaparkan "tekad kolektif" untuk menangani pengganasan.
Beliau juga memuji kemudahan tersebut atas pencapaiannya dalam mengesan kepantasan ideologi pelampau di rantau ini yang membawa kepada tindakan susulan oleh agensi-agensi keselamatan serantau.

Sejak memulakan operasinya pada Januari 2021, CTIF sudah menghasilkan produk risikan yang tepat pada masanya dengan negara-negara rakan kongsi serta sudah membantu rantau ini dalam usaha kolektif menentang pengganasan, menurut MINDEF.
Dr Ng juga bertemu dengan para wakil daripada negara-negara rakan kongsi semasa majlis perasmian tersebut dan mengucapkan terima kasih kepada mereka atas sokongan padu yang ditunjukkan.

documents.title: Counter-terrorism facility opens in S'pore to boost regional cooperation, info sharing

sentences.content: SINGAPORE - A facility in Singapore for countries in South-east Asia to enhance cooperation in tackling terrorism and to share intelligence was opened on Wednesday.
The Counter-Terrorism Information Facility is set up by the Ministry of Defence (Mindef).

"The Counter-Terrorism Information Facility is a multilateral, inter-agency facility that brings together like-minded countries to share intelligence and provide early warning against terrorism in the region," said Mindef.

It added that while much of its operations remains classified for regional security reasons, the facility is crucial to synergising counter-terrorism efforts with the use of collective intelligence and data.
In a Facebook post on Wednesday, Defence Minister Ng Eng Hen said that the facility’s location is in Changi.
He commended the facility on its achievements in detecting the spread of extremist ideologies in the region, which led to follow-up actions by regional security agencies.
Mindef said that the facility has produced timely "intelligence products" with partner nations.
It has also assisted the region in the collective effort against terrorism.
In March 2021, Dr Ng said that combating transnational terrorist threats remains a key focus for the Singapore Armed Forces.

As Asean's collective intelligence and surveillance capability may be a fraction of what the United States and its allies in the Middle East have, the facility was created to close that gap and pre-empt terror attacks, he said then.

The latest edition of the Singapore Terrorism Threat Assessment Report released by the Internal Security Department in July 2022, which takes stock of the security environment here and regionally, said that the terrorism threat to Singapore remains high, as the country continues to feature on extremist propaganda.
The resumption of international travel after the Covid-19 pandemic also raises concerns about how terror plots put on ice in the region may resume, added the report.
Dr Ng said on Wednesday that there must be an expectation for an increase in the influx of returning and foreign extremists to the region now that Covid-19 travel restrictions have eased.
"We must, therefore, redouble our efforts in counter-terrorism collectively.
Sharing what we each know will multiply our understanding of regional trends and developments," he added.

documents.title: Threat of terrorism remains 'high and increasingly fluid' as networks have grown in sophistication: Ng Eng Hen

sentences.content: Dr Ng was speaking at the inauguration ceremony for the opening of the Counter-Terrorism Information Facility (CTIF) on Wednesday (Sep 21).

While much of the facility's operations remain classified for regional security reasons, MINDEF added that it is crucial to "synergise" counter-terrorism efforts with the use of collective intelligence and data-driven methods.
Dr Ng also met representatives from partner nations at the inauguration ceremony and thanked them for their strong support.

silver_truth: On September 21, 2022, the Counter-Terrorism Information Facility (CTIF) was inaugurated in Singapore. This multilateral, inter-agency facility, set up by the Ministry of Defence (Mindef), aims to enhance cooperation among South-east Asian countries in tackling terrorism by sharing intelligence and providing early warnings. Defence Minister Dr. Ng Eng Hen officiated the launch, highlighting the persistent and evolving threat of terrorism due to sophisticated and expanding terrorist networks. He emphasized the necessity of collective intelligence and data-driven methods to counter these threats. Since its operations began in January 2021, CTIF has produced timely intelligence products in collaboration with partner nations, aiding regional security agencies in responding to extremist ideologies. Dr. Ng acknowledged the invaluable contributions of partner nations and stressed the importance of redoubling counter-terrorism efforts, especially as international travel resumes post-Covid-19, potentially increasing the influx of foreign extremists. The facility's location was disclosed to be in Changi, and while many of its operations remain classified for security reasons, its role in synchronizing regional counter-terrorism initiatives is deemed crucial.

documents.title: Rakyat Russia panik tempah tiket penerbangan

sentences.content: MOSCOW: Sebilangan besar rakyat Russia bergegas untuk menempah tiket sehala keluar dari negara itu sementara mereka masih boleh melakukan demikian.
Ia susulan Presiden Russia Vladimir Putin mengumumkan kerahan sebahagian anggota simpanan tentera untuk perang di Ukraine.
Tiket penerbangan terjual dengan cepat dan harganya melambung tinggi.
Ia kelihatan didorong oleh kebimbangan bahawa sempadan Russia akan ditutup tidak lama lagi.
Selain itu, ada yang risau bahawa Putin mengumumkan panggilan untuk berperang yang lebih meluas, dalam kalangan rakyatnya, dengan menghantar ramai lelaki Russia ke barisan hadapan perang.

Tiket Moscow-Belgrade dikendalikan Air Serbia, iaitu satu-satunya syarikat Eropah selain Turkish Airlines yang mengekalkan penerbangan ke Russia, walaupun terdapat sekatan penerbangan Kesatuan Eropah (EU), didapati habis dijual untuk beberapa hari berikutnya.

Harga penerbangan dari Moscow ke Istanbul atau Dubai, meningkat dalam beberapa minit sebelum melonjak lagi sehingga mencecah setinggi 9,200 euro (RM41,312) untuk tambang kelas ekonomi bagi penerbangan sehala.
Dekri Putin menetapkan bahawa jumlah orang yang dipanggil untuk bertugas aktif akan ditentukan oleh Kementerian Pertahanan.

Sebelum ini, Menteri Pertahanan Russia, Sergei Shoigu, berkata negara itu akan menggerakkan kira-kira 300,000 anggota simpanan selepas Putin menerusi ucapan di televisyen memberi amaran Moscow akan menggunakan semua aset ketenteraannya untuk menentang Ukraine.
Rakyat Russia yang panik dan tidak lama kemudian 'membanjiri' rangkaian sosial.
Trafik tinggi dalam rangkaian sosial dalam Bahasa Russia dengan banyak berkisarkan nasihat mengenai cara mengelakkan mobilisasi atau meninggalkan negara itu.

Kumpulan antiperang berkata, tiket kapal terbang yang terhad untuk keluar dari Russia mencapai harga yang sangat tinggi kerana permintaan sangat mendadak sehingga penawaran tidak dapat tersedia segera.
Russia sudah pun menyaksikan perpindahan penduduk yang ketara sejak Putin mengarahkan tenteranya untuk menyerang Ukraine hampir tujuh bulan lalu. - AP

documents.title: Flights out of Russia selling out fast after Putin orders partial call-up

sentences.content: Mr Putin’s announcement, made in an early-morning television address, raised fears that some men of fighting age would not be allowed to leave the country.
Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu said the call-up would be limited to those with experience as professional soldiers, and that students and conscripts would not be called up.
The Kremlin declined to comment on whether the borders would be closed to those subject to the mobilisation order, and asked people to be patient as the law is clarified.
Meanwhile, Google Trends data showed a spike in searches for Aviasales, Russia’s most popular flight-booking site.
Direct  flights from Moscow to Istanbul in Turkey and Yerevan in Armenia, both destinations that allow Russians to enter without a visa, were sold out on Wednesday, according to Aviasales data.
Flights from Moscow to Istanbul via Turkish Airlines were either all booked or unavailable until Sunday, as of 1415 Moscow time (1115 GMT).

Some routes with stopovers, including those from Moscow to Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia, were also unavailable, while the cheapest  flights to Dubai cost more than 300,000 roubles (S$7,000) – about five times the average monthly wage.
Typical one-way fares to Turkey shot up to almost 70,000 roubles, compared with a little over 22,000 roubles a week ago, Google  Flights data shows.
The head of Russia’s tourism agency said no restrictions have been imposed on travelling abroad so far.

documents.title: Flights out of Russia sell out after Putin orders partial call-up

sentences.content: GDANSK, Poland: One-way flights out of Russia were selling out fast on Wednesday (Sep 21) after President Vladimir Putin ordered the immediate call-up of 300,000 reservists.
Putin's announcement, made in an early-morning television address, raised fears that some men of fighting age would not be allowed to leave Russia.

Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu said the call-up would be limited to those with experience as professional soldiers, and that students and those who had only served as conscripts would not be called up.
Nevertheless, Google Trends data showed a spike in searches for Aviasales, which is Russia's most popular website for purchasing flights.
Direct flights from Moscow to Istanbul in Turkey and Yerevan in Armenia, both destinations that allow Russians to enter without a visa, were sold out on Wednesday, according to Aviasales data.

Some routes with stopovers, including those from Moscow to Tbilisi, were also unavailable, while the cheapest flights from the capital to Dubai cost more than 300,000 roubles (US$5,000) - about five times the average monthly wage.

silver_truth: On September 21, 2022, President Vladimir Putin announced the mobilization of 300,000 military reservists in a televised address, causing widespread panic among Russian citizens. This announcement led to a surge in one-way flight bookings as people feared the borders might soon close and that men of fighting age would be restricted from leaving the country. Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu clarified that the call-up would be limited to those with professional military experience, excluding students and conscripts. Nevertheless, Google Trends data revealed a spike in searches for Aviasales, Russia’s leading flight-booking website. Direct flights from Moscow to destinations such as Istanbul, Yerevan, and Dubai saw rapid sellouts, and ticket prices soared dramatically. For instance, one-way flights to Dubai reached over 300,000 roubles, about five times the average monthly wage. The head of Russia’s tourism agency stated that no travel restrictions had been imposed yet. Despite these assurances, the high demand for flights out of Russia persisted, reflecting the public's anxiety over the mobilization and potential travel restrictions.

documents.title: Thailand tahan taikun Myanmar kes dadah, penggubahan wang haram

sentences.content: BANGKOK: Pihak berkuasa Thailand menahan seorang taikun Myanmar yang disyaki mengedar dadah malah terdapat tiga sumber mendakwa suspek mempunyai kaitan dengan junta tentera Myanmar.

Jurucakap Polis Thailand, Kissana Phathanacharoen, berkata Tun Min Latt, 53, bersama tiga lagi warga Thailand ditahan di bandar raya ini dalam serbuan awal pagi minggu lalu, atas tuduhan bersubahat mengedar narkotik dan penggubahan wang haram.
"Polis sedang dalam proses meminta mahkamah untuk penahanan pra-perbicaraan," kata Kissana kepada Reuters melalui telefon.
Sementara itu, tiga sumber memberitahu Reuters bahawa Min Latt, yang mempunyai kepentingan perniagaan dalam hotel, tenaga dan perlombongan adalah sekutu rapat pemimpin junta Myanmar, Min Aung Hlaing.
Pihak berkuasa British menyekat satu daripada perniagaan Min Latt pada Ogos lalu, dalam apa yang mereka nyatakan sebagai 'usaha untuk mengehadkan akses tentera kepada senjata dan pendapatan'.
Media kerajaan Myanmar sebelum ini turut menyiarkan gambar Min Latt bersama ketua junta, termasuk di pameran senjata di Bangkok pada 2019.

Dokumen Pertubuhan Bangsa-Bangsa Bersatu (PBB) 2019 mendakwa Min Latt adalah anak kepada seorang pegawai tentera Myanmar berpangkat Leftenan Kolonel yang sudah bersara dan syarikat miliknya memberikan sumbangan berjumlah kira-kira AS$71,500 (RM324,288) kepada tentera Myanmar pada 2017.

Tentera Myanmar merampas kuasa daripada kerajaan demokrasi yang dipimpin oleh Aung San Suu Kyi pada Februari 2021 dan sejak itu berusaha untuk menyatukan kuasa melalui tindakan keras terhadap pembangkang.
Permintaan Reuters untuk mendapatkan komen daripada Min Latt dan syarikatnya bagaimanapun tidak berhasil malah panggilan kepada jurucakap tentera Myanmar juga tidak dijawab.
Dalam kenyataan itu, Kissana berkata, unit antidadah polis meminta mahkamah melanjutkan penahanan suspek untuk mengumpul lebih banyak bukti dan menyiasat rangkaian itu.
Beliau berkata polis turut merampas aset bernilai lebih 200 juta baht (RM24.4 juta) daripada empat suspek itu.

Sumber yang mempunyai maklumat mengenai kes Min Latt - yang enggan dinamakan kerana mereka tidak diberi kuasa untuk bercakap dengan media - berkata, penahanannya adalah sebahagian daripada tindakan keras Thalandi terhadap penggubahan wang haram daripada sumber narkotik di bandar sempadan Tachileik di Shan, Myanmar.
Bagaimanapun, Pejabat Lembaga Kawalan Narkotik kerajaan Thailand enggan mengulas lanjut. - REUTERS

documents.title: Taikun dadah Myanmar ditahan

sentences.content: Bangkok: Pihak berkuasa Thailand menahan seorang taikun Myanmar yang disyaki terbabit dalam penyeludupan dadah, Rabu lalu.
Menurut sumber, suspek juga dipercayai mempunyai kaitan dengan pemimpin junta tentera Myanmar.

Tun Min Latt, 53, ditahan di ibu negara Thailand, dalam serbuan awal pagi minggu lalu, bersama tiga warga Thailand, atas tuduhan bersubahat mengedar dadah dan pengubahan wang haram, kata Timbalan Jurucakap Polis Thailand, Kissana Phathanacharoen.
"Polis sedang dalam proses mendapatkan perintah mahkamah untuk penahanan praperbicaraan," kata Phathanacharoen.
Menurut tiga sumber Reuters, Min Latt memiliki perniagaan perhotelan, tenaga dan perlombongan adalah sekutu rapat pemimpin junta Myanmar Min Aung Hlaing selain menyalurkan bekalan kepada tentera.
Media kerajaan Myanmar menyiarkan gambar beliau bersama ketua junta termasuk di pameran senjata di Bangkok pada 2019.
Pada Ogos, pihak berkuasa Britian memaklumkan satu daripada perniagaan Min Latt dilihat sebagai usaha mengawal akses tentera kepada senjata dan pendapatan.

documents.title: Thailand arrests Myanmar military-linked businessman suspected of drug trafficking

sentences.content: BANGKOK - Thai authorities said on Wednesday that they had detained a Myanmar tycoon suspected of drug trafficking, whom three sources said was linked to the upper echelons of Myanmar's ruling military junta.
"Police are in the process of requesting the court for pre-trial detention," Mr Kissana told Reuters by phone.
British authorities sanctioned one of Tun Min Latt's businesses in August in what they called an "effort to limit the military's access to arms and revenue".

A 2019 United Nations document says Tun Min Latt is the son of a retired Myanmar lieutenant colonel and that a company he part-owns had made donations amounting to about US$71,500 (S$101,000) to the Myanmar military in 2017.
Reuters' requests for comment from Tun Min Latt and his companies were not answered.
Calls to a Myanmar military spokesman also went unanswered.
In a statement, Mr Kissana later said the police anti-drugs unit had asked a court to extend the suspects' detention to gather more evidence and investigate the network.
He said police also confiscated assets worth over 200 million baht (S$7.6 million) from the four suspects.

Myanmar's military seized power from the democratically elected government led by Ms Aung San Suu Kyi in February 2021, and has since sought to consolidate power through a deadly crackdown on opposition.

A source with knowledge of Tun Min Latt's case - who asked not to be named because they were not authorised to speak to media - said his arrest is part of a broader Thai crackdown on money laundering from narcotics in the border town of Tachileik in Myanmar's Shan state.
The Thai government's Office of the Narcotics Control Board declined comment.
REUTERS

silver_truth: On September 21, 2022, Thai authorities announced the detention of a Myanmar tycoon, Tun Min Latt, suspected of drug trafficking and money laundering. Tun Min Latt, aged 53, was arrested in Bangkok along with three Thai nationals during a dawn raid the previous week. The arrest is part of a broader Thai crackdown on money laundering related to narcotics in the border town of Tachileik in Myanmar's Shan state. Thai police, led by Deputy Spokesperson Kissana Phathanacharoen, are seeking court approval for pre-trial detention to gather more evidence and investigate the network. Authorities confiscated assets worth over 200 million baht from the suspects.

documents.title: Stocks gyrate, dollar gains as Fed keeps hawkish stance

sentences.content: NEW YORK :  U.S. stocks rose, then slumped while Treasury yields surged and then fell on Wednesday as markets reacted wildly to a bleak economic picture next year after the Federal Reserve adhered to a tough stance to fight inflation by jacking up interest rates.

The three main stock indices jolted up and down, the yield on benchmark 10-year Treasury notes spiked to 3.6401 per cent and the dollar surged to a fresh two-decade high after the Fed raised rates by 75 basis points as expected.
The Fed also said in a statement following a two-day meeting of policymakers that it expects its policy rate to hit 4.4 per cent by year's end and rise to 4.6 per cent by the end of 2023.

The Fed's aggressive drive to lower inflation to its 2 per cent target will take years and comes at a cost of slower growth and higher unemployment, according to projections from policymakers that cast doubt on market hopes for a "soft landing."
The projections show Americans are in for some pain as the U.S. central bank works to end inflation and prevent what Fed Chair Jerome Powell has said would otherwise be even worse outcomes.

"The Fed reset the expectations in order to eliminate counterproductive speculation by market participants of a pivot, for now," said Johan Grahn, head of ETFs at Allianz Investment Management LLC in Minneapolis.

"It's a logical action by a 'Volcker-courageous' Fed, but one that they can walk back at a later date if needed," Grahn said, referring to former Fed chief Paul Volcker, who tamed double-digit inflation four decades ago by inducing a recession.
"It takes a while to anchor to the new normal," Schleif said.
"Investors keep wanting to hear something more positive, and they weren't hearing that positive tilt they wanted."
Ellen Hazen, chief market strategist at F.L.Putnam  Investment Management in Wellesley, Massachusetts, said the equity market was a little bit too optimistic that the Fed might soften its language.
After the the past four meetings of the Federal Open Market Committee, stocks rallied only to fall the following day.
"A lot of times you see (the market) do something on the day of and then something else the next day.
Investors might want to reserve judgment until tomorrow," Hazen said, when stocks were trading higher on the day.
Graphic: Fed's four-meeting streak snapped https://graphics.reuters.com/USA-STOCKS/egpbkrdbxvq/chart.png
The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed down 1.7 per cent, the S&P 500 lost 1.71 per cent and the Nasdaq Composite dropped 1.79 per cent.

After an initial negative reaction, markets mostly shrugged off Russian President Vladimir Putin accusing the West of "nuclear blackmail," remarks that sparked a flight to safe-haven assets like gold and bonds.
The pan-regional STOXX 600 index in Europe closed up 0.90 per cent after earlier sliding to its lowest level since early July when Putin announced the military mobilization.
MSCI's gauge of stocks worldwide fell 1.55 per cent.
The 10-year Treasury yield fell 5.7 basis points to 3.516 per cent after a big spike following the Fed statement.
Two-year yields were last at 4.0506 per cent, after earlier hitting 4.123 per cent, the highest since October 2007.
The closely watched yield curve between two- and 10-year notes inverted further to minus 53 basis points, indicating concerns about a recession in the next year or two.
The dollar index rose 1.026 per cent, with the euro down 1.27 per cent to $0.9843.

The Japanese yen weakened 0.19 per cent versus the greenback at 143.98 per dollar,
Oil prices fell after the Fed hiked rates to quell inflation as it may also reduce economic activity.
Brent crude futures settled 79 cents lower at $89.83 a barrel, its lowest close in two weeks, while U.S. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude fell $1.00 to $82.94, its lowest close since Sept. 7.
U.S. gold futures settled up 0.3 per cent at $1,675.70 an ounce.
Bitcoin was mostly flat, up 0.04 per cent at $18,886.00.

documents.title: US dollar soars to two-decade high as Fed flags more large hikes

sentences.content: NEW YORK :The dollar surged to a fresh two-decade high on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve raised interest rates by another 75 basis points and signalled more large increases at its upcoming meetings.
Dollar gains were limited since the Fed decision was widely expected.
Still, since U.S. rates will be higher for longer, the trend remains dollar-supportive for some time, analysts said.
The Fed's new projections showed its policy rate rising to 4.4 per cent by the end of the year, before peaking at 4.6 per cent in 2023 to curb uncomfortably high inflation.
Rate cuts are not expected until 2024.
Fed Chair Jerome Powell, in his press briefing, said there is no painless way to bring inflation down, reiterating that it wants to act aggressively now and keep at it.
He added that the Fed's actions are likely to result in slower growth and higher unemployment.
The dollar index hit a fresh 20-year high of 111.63 in the aftermath of the Fed rate hike, and was last up 0.7 per cent at 110.97.

"We expect the U.S. dollar to remain firm in the short run but we remain reluctant to factor in additional, sustained U.S. dollar gains from here and we think it would be complacent to dismiss out of hand downside risks here," said Shaun Osborne, chief FX strategist, at Scotiabank in Toronto.
He said that the dollar has become significantly overvalued.
Since the beginning of the year, the dollar index has soared nearly 16 per cent, the largest yearly percentage gain since at least 1972, when Refinitiv started the data series.

Osborne also said higher U.S. rate expectations have already been priced in the dollar, with the peak fed funds rate, or the U.S. central bank's policy rate, having advanced by more than 100 bps since August.
The euro, the largest component in the dollar index, dropped to a 20-year low, hitting $0.9810.
Europe's single currency last changed hands at $0.9852, down 1.2 per cent.
Against the yen, the dollar posted minor gains compared to other currencies, rising as high as 144.695 yen.
The greenback last traded at 143.98 yen, up 0.2 per cent on the day.
Traders remained wary of pushing the dollar higher given the threat of Japan intervention to boost the yen.
"They (the Fed) have a brief window to act aggressively, and they seem eager to use it," said Jan Szilagyi, co-founder and CEO of Toggle AI, an investment research firm.
"There is another reason to frontload the hikes.
Public and market tolerance for tighter monetary policy is far higher with the unemployment rate below 4 per cent, a historic low."
Sterling fell to a new 37-year low of $1.1237 and last traded at $1.1272, down nearly 1 per cent.
Earlier in the session, the dollar posted gains after a decision by Russian President Vladimir Putin to mobilize more troops for the conflict in Ukraine.

Putin on Wednesday called up 300,000 reservists to fight in Ukraine and said Moscow would respond with the might of all its vast arsenal if the West pursued what he called its "nuclear blackmail" over the conflict there.

European currencies bore the brunt of selling in foreign exchange markets as Putin's comments exacerbated concern about the economic outlook for a region already hit hard by Russia's squeeze on gas supplies to Europe.
Osborne noted that elevated geopolitical risks have underpinned the dollar as a safe haven and alternatives are scarce in the developed world.
"We think the time is coming for a U.S. dollar correction but dollar bears will have to remain patient for a little longer," he said.
