The Fed projected its policy rate would reach 4.4% by the end of the year and 4.6% by the end of 2023, indicating that efforts to reduce inflation to the 2% target would lead to slower growth and higher unemployment. This tough stance led to declines in major stock indices, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average, S&P 500, and Nasdaq Composite all closing down around 1.7%.

documents.title: Zero-Covid-19 harming 75% of European firms in China: Business group

sentences.content: BEIJING - China's "inflexible" and "inconsistent" zero-Covid-19 policy is crippling European business operations in the country, a major business lobby said Wednesday, warning that the presence of the companies "can no longer be taken for granted".

The report by the European Union's Chamber of Commerce in China marks the latest statement by the foreign business community that Beijing's hardline virus curbs are harming the world's second-largest economy and isolating it on the international stage.
China is the last major economy wedded to a strategy of stamping out emerging virus outbreaks as they arise, through a combination of snap lockdowns, mass testing and lengthy quarantines.

Despite sparking business closures and roiling global supply chains, President Xi Jinping has declared the approach China's most "economic and effective" path forward, and officials have not indicated when the rules might be eased.

The European Chamber - a group of more than 1,800 European companies in China - said in a position paper that zero-Covid-19 and its "massive uncertainty" had had a "negative impact" on 75 per cent of its members' operations.

"China's business environment will remain unpredictable as long as the threat of lockdowns exists," the organisation said, calling Mr Xi's flagship policy "inflexible and inconsistently implemented" and cautioning that ideology seemed to be "trumping the economy".
It added that the situation had prompted nearly a quarter of firms to consider shifting current or planned investments out of China, the highest percentage in the past decade.
Despite China's significant growth potential, "the extent of European firms' engagement can no longer be taken for granted", the report said.
China in June reduced the length of mandatory quarantine for inbound travellers from 21 to 10 days, but a lack of flights and sky-high ticket prices remain a major obstacle to travel.
The near-total shutdown of the country's borders since 2020 has quickened an "exodus" of European nationals and left those who remain more isolated than before, according to the report.
If Beijing continues to persist with the policy, "the business environment will continue to become more challenging", it said.

In a foreword to the report, European Chamber President Joerg Wuttke wrote that "the rest of the world has largely resumed pre-pandemic levels of 'normality', but China remains reluctant to open its doors".
European companies "need China to fulfil its huge economic potential", he added.
China's economy expanded just 0.4 per cent in the second quarter as virus restrictions across swathes of the country caused business shutdowns and roiled supply chains.
Analysts say the country is set to miss its annual growth target of around 5.5 per cent by a wide margin.
AFP

documents.title: European business group warns of loss of confidence in China

sentences.content: SHANGHAI: A top European industry group warned on Wednesday (Sep 21) that firms were losing confidence in China and that its standing as an investment destination was being eroded, citing its "inflexible and inconsistently implemented" COVID-19 policy as a key factor.

The European Chamber of Commerce published the warnings in a paper it said had input from 1,800 member companies, which also contained 967 recommendations for China, the European Union and European companies related to doing business in the country.

The report, which touched on issues from Taiwan to trade, said, for example, that China should refrain from "erratic policy shifts", deepen cooperation with the European Union and increase international flights.
The European Union should proactively engage with China and reject calls for disengagement, it added.

A "stark contrast" has emerged between China and the rest of the world over the past year, as other countries remain committed to globalisation while China continues to turn inward, the chamber's president, Joerg Wuttke, told a media briefing.

"The world lives with herd immunity, and China waits until the world gets rid of Omicron, which is of course unlikely," he said, referring to China's rigid zero-COVID stance, which has led to frequent lockdowns and kept borders mostly shut to international travel.
China says its policy is needed to prevent its health system from being overwhelmed as well as an unacceptable loss of life.

Besides COVID, the chamber said stalled reforms of China's state-owned enterprises, an exodus of European nationals from China coupled with travel restrictions for Chinese staff to go abroad as well as increased politicisation of business were also harming China's attractiveness.
The report said record numbers of businesses looked to shift current or planned investments to other markets.
Last month, a US business lobby said China's strict COVID-19 control measures had overtaken sour US-China relations as the top concern of US companies in the country.

China is one of the few countries still requiring travellers to quarantine on arrival, and Wuttke said the chamber remained hopeful that restrictions could loosen after the ruling Communist Party's five-yearly congress, which starts Oct 16.

While Xi Jinping is expected to secure a historic third leadership term, it is not yet clear who will join him on the Politburo Standing Committee and who will replace Premier Li Keqiang, who is set to retire in March from his role whose main remit is managing the world's second-largest economy.
Wuttke said that Vice Premier Liu He, who is expected to retire from his current position, always stood for reform and "would be hard to replace".
"We have to see what the line-up is in the economic decision-making, and that might give us some indications of where this country is heading," he said.

silver_truth: On September 21, 2022, the European Union's Chamber of Commerce in China released a report criticizing China's "inflexible" and "inconsistent" zero-COVID-19 policy, which has severely impacted European business operations in the country. The report highlighted that 75% of European companies in China experienced negative effects due to the policy, with nearly a quarter considering relocating investments. Despite China's significant growth potential, the unpredictable business environment and stringent virus control measures have caused a loss of confidence among European firms. The near-total border shutdown since 2020 has exacerbated the situation, leading to an exodus of European nationals.

documents.title: Harga COE kereta ditutup lebih rendah dalam bidaan terkini

sentences.content: SINGAPURA: Premium Sijil Hak Memiliki Kenderaan (COE) untuk kereta ditutup lebih rendah dalam bidaan terkini pada Rabu (21 Sep).
Harga COE bagi Kategori A, atau sehingga 1,600cc dan kuasa kuda tidak melebihi 130bhp, premium ditutup pada S$84,000, turun berbanding S$86,000 dalam bidaan lalu.
Premium bagi kereta lebih besar dan berkuasa lebih tinggi dalam Kategori B merosot kepada S$108,051 dari S$113,000.
Harga COE bagi Kategori Terbuka, yang boleh digunakan bagi semua jenis kenderaan tetapi biasanya digunakan untuk kereta besar jatuh, merosot kepada S$107,201 dari S$113,299.
Sementara itu, COE buat Kategori C iaitu bagi kenderaan komersil termasuk kenderaan muatan dan bas, premium meningkat kepada S$67,001 dari S$64,989 dalam biadaan lalu.
Premium motosikal ataupun Kategori D pula ditutup pada S$11,589, naik berbanding S$11,301 dalam bidaan lalu.
Secara keseluruhannya, sebanyak 2,424 bidaan diterima dengan sebanyak 1,785 COE diperuntukkan.
Ini merupakan bidaan keempat di bawah kaedah pengiraan kuota COE yang disemak semula, bertujuan untuk mengurangkan keadaan tidak menentu dalam bekalan COE.
Di bawah kaedah pengiraan yang disemak semula, bekalan COE akan berdasarkan purata pembatalan pendaftaran kenderaan dalam masa dua suku berbanding satu suku.

documents.title: Premium COE motosikal capai $11,751, tertinggi sepanjang masa buat dua tender berturut-turut; kategori lain turun

sentences.content: HARGA sijil Sijil Hak Memiliki Kenderaan (COE) motosikal mencatat rekod baru buat dua tender berturut-turut pada Rabu (5 Okt) walaupun premium bagi  semua kategori lain merosot.
Premium COE motosikal, yang mencecah rekod tertinggi $11,589 pada bidaan sebelumnya, berakhir pada $11,751, kenaikan sebanyak 1.4 peratus.

Dalam kategori kereta  dengan enjin lebih kecil sehingga 1,600cc dan 130bhp, serta  kenderaan elektrik (EV)  sepenuhnya (EV) dengan kuasa sehingga 110 kilowatt, premium turun daripada $84,000 kepada $80,501 – turun 4.2 peratus.
Bagi kereta dengan enjin lebih besar serta EV yang lebih berkuasa, harga COE-nya ialah $95,856, iaitu penurunan 11.3 peratus daripada $108,051 yang dicatatkan pada bidaan terakhir.
Ini kali pertama sejak Mei tahun ini harga  COE kategori itu berada di bawah paras enam angka.
COE kenderaan komersial turun 1.5 peratus  kepada $65,991 daripada  kepada $67,001.
Premium bagi COE kategori Terbuka, yang biasanya digunakan untuk kereta lebih besar, turun 2.1 peratus kepada $105,001 daripada $107,201.

documents.title: COE prices for car categories down in latest tender; premium for motorcycles hits new high of $11,589

sentences.content: SINGAPORE - Certificate of entitlement (COE) premiums for motorcycles hit a new record of $11,589 in the latest tender exercise that closed on Wednesday.
Commercial vehicle COE prices also went up, but those for car COE categories were down.
The motorcycle COE premium was 2.5 per cent higher than the $11,301 set in the last tender and broke the record of $11,400 set in March 2022.
For cars with engines up to 1,600cc and below 130bhp, as well as fully electric vehicles (EVs) with up to 110 kilowatts of power, the COE price is $84,000, down 2.3 per cent from $86,000.
In the category for more powerful cars and EVs, the COE price ended at $108,051, down 4.4 per cent from $113,000.
For commercial vehicles, the COE premium went up by 3.1 per cent, from $64,989 to $67,001.
The latest tender was the second time that motorcycle COEs broke records in 2022.

Mr Rex Tan, president of the Singapore Motor Cycle Trade Association, said motorcycle buyers are taking on longer loan contracts to keep their monthly instalments manageable due to the higher prices as COE premiums rise.
Given that there are little signs of more motorcycle COEs being released for tender, he does not expect premiums to come down any time soon.
At the same time, they said that the tender exercise also reflects how weak the demand for cars has been during this period.
Buyers of larger and more powerful cars and EVs may be holding back after COE premiums for such vehicles hit record highs in the past two tenders.
In the tender for COEs in this category, there were just 82 more bids received than what were available.
This was the first time in 2022 that the number of excess bids in this category dropped below three digits.
This means that there are not many orders taken for cars in this category.
Following the latest tender results, car dealers would likely be advertising lower prices.

documents.title: COE prices for cars close lower in latest bidding exercise, premium for motorcycles hits new high

sentences.content: Premiums for Category A cars, or those 1,600cc and below with horsepower not exceeding 130bhp, closed at S$84,000, down from S$86,000 in the previous exercise.
Open Category COEs, which can be used for any vehicle type but end up being used mainly for large cars, fell to S$107,201 from S$113,299.
Category C COEs, which are for commercial vehicles including goods vehicles and buses, rose to S$67,001 from S$64,989 in the previous bidding exercise.
A total of 2,424 bids were received, with a quota of 1,785 COEs available.
Under the adjusted counting method, the COE supply will be based on a rolling average of vehicle deregistrations over two quarters instead of one.

silver_truth: On September 21, 2022, the Certificate of Entitlement (COE) premiums in Singapore experienced significant changes across various vehicle categories. For Category A cars (those up to 1,600cc and with horsepower not exceeding 130bhp), the premium dropped to S$84,000 from S$86,000. Larger and more powerful cars in Category B saw their COE prices fall to S$108,051 from S$113,000, while the Open Category COEs, typically used for large cars, decreased to S$107,201 from S$113,299. Conversely, COE premiums for commercial vehicles in Category C rose to S$67,001 from S$64,989, and motorcycle COEs in Category D increased to S$11,589 from S$11,301, marking a new record high.

documents.title: Tikam bekas temanita sehingga mati: Warga China dijel 12 tahun

sentences.content: SELEPAS gagal dalam beberapa percubaan untuk menyelamatkan hubungan dengan bekas teman wanitanya, seorang lelaki yang mabuk membawa sebilah pisau dan menunggu wanita itu berhampiran rumahnya.
Apabila melihat wanita itu, Zheng Xianfeng bersemuka dengannya dalam keadaan marah dan menikam dada dan perut mangsanya berkali-kali.
Dia tidak berhenti walaupun selepas seorang penunggang alat mobiliti peribadi lalu di situ dan merempuhnya.
Mangsa, Cik Tham Mee Yoke, 34 tahun, mengalami sekurang-kurangnya 29 tikaman dan tetakan serta patah tiga tulang rusuknya. Beliau meninggal dunia akibat kecederaannya itu.

Zheng, 37 tahun, dijatuhi hukuman penjara 12 tahun oleh Mahkamah Tinggi semalam selepas dia mengaku bersalah atas pertuduhan kesalahan homisid kerana menikam Cik Tham hingga mati sebelum tengah malam pada 16 Februari 2021, berhampiran kolong Blok 308 Jurong East Street 32.
Warga China itu pada asalnya didakwa membunuh, tetapi pertuduhan tersebut dikurangkan kerana dia dinilai mengalami gangguan kemurungan utama yang mengurangkan tanggungjawab terhadap tindakannya itu.

Empat pertuduhan lain telah diambil kira. Ini termasuk satu tuduhan mencederakan Cik Tham dengan pisau lipat tiga bulan sebelum pembunuhan itu, dua tuduhan kerana mencederakan abangnya dan satu tuduhan kerana menyebabkan gangguan apabila mabuk.
Mahkamah mendengar bahawa Zheng bertemu dengan Cik Tham, warga Malaysia, pada Disember 2018 ketika mereka menyewa bilik berasingan di unit yang sama dan menjalin hubungan dengannya.

Semalam, Timbalan Pendakwa Raya, Cik Teo Lu Jia, memohon hukuman penjara 10 hingga 12 tahun dikenakan memandangkan niat tertuduh membunuh si wanita itu, dan sifat serta berat kesalahan tersebut menyebabkan keresahan yang ketara terhadap orang ramai.
Beliau menyatakan bahawa serangan itu adalah kejam dan tidak henti-henti, selain mempunyai pertuduhan berkaitan keganasan dan Zheng telah melakukan kesalahan semula semasa diikat jamin.
Peguam bela, Encik Leo Cheng Suan, pula meminta hukuman penjara diringankan kepada lapan hingga 10 tahun.
Beliau berkata anak guamnya ingin memohon maaf kepada keluarga mangsa dan berhasrat memberi penghormatan kepada mangsa selepas dibebaskan dari penjara.

documents.title: Lelaki dihukum penjara 12 tahun tikam bekas temanita sampai mati

sentences.content: SINGAPURA: Seorang lelaki berusia 37 tahun dijatuhkan hukuman penjara 12 tahun pada Rabu (21 Sep) setelah dia menikam bekas temanitanya sehingga mati di Jurong East pada Februari 2021.

Zheng Xianfeng menyerang bekas temanitanya, Tham Mee Yoke, dan terus menghayunkan pisau ke arah mangsa walaupun seorang lelaki yang menaiki alat mobiliti peribadinya (PMD) bergerak ke arah Zheng untuk cuba menghentikan serangan tersebut.
Tham meninggal dunia akibat kecederaannya setelah dibawa ke hospital.
Zheng, seorang warganegara China, dihukum penjara pada Rabu (21 Sep) setelah dia mengaku bersalah atas satu tuduhan membunuh tanpa niat yang tidak membawa kepada pembunuhan Tham.

Empat tuduhan lain, termasuk menyebabkan gangguan ketika mabuk, mencederakan saudara lelakinya serta mencederakan Tham menggunakan pisau lipat dalam satu insiden sebelum itu, dipertimbangkan semasa hukuman dijatuhkan.

"Tertuduh menghantarkan mesej kepada mangsa, menyatakan mangsa kelihatan gembira selepas mereka berpisah, manakala dia pula tidak gembira dan kesunyian," Timbalan Pendakwa Raya Teo Lu Jia memberitahu mahkamah.

Zheng menogok minuman keras sebelum meninggalkan rumahnya dengan sebilah pisau sepanjang 26.5 sentimeter yang disimpan di seluarnya. Dia membeli makanan ringan dan lebih banyak minuman keras sebelum minum di tempat awam.
Sekitar pukul 10.00 malam, Zheng menuju ke sebuah ruang penduduk berdekatan rumah mangsa dan terus menogok minuman keras sambil menantikannya kehadiran wanita itu.
Mangsa tiba di kolong Blok 308 Jurong East Street 32 sekitar tengah malam.

Tiga lelaki yang berada di kawasan tersebut terlihat Zheng berjalan dengan pantas ke arah Tham. Salah seorang daripada mereka menghubungi polis apabila beliau ternampak pisau yang disimpan di seluar Zheng.
Tham mengangkat tangannya sambil mengundurkan diri dari Zheng. Zheng kemudian mengeluarkan pisau itu dan mula menikam Tham beberapa kali di bahagian dada serta perut.
Salah seorang daripada tiga saksi itu menggerakkan PMD yang dinaikinya ke arah Zheng untuk cuba menghentikan perbuatannya.

"Disebabkan kesan itu, tertuduh menghentikan seketika serangannya tetapi selepas itu, dengan pantas menyambung semula untuk menikam mangsa di bahagian atas tubuhnya. Tertuduh berulang kali menikam mangsa di bahagian dada dan perutnya dengan niat untuk menyebabkan kematiannya," hujah Cik Teo.
Teriakan Tham menarik perhatian enam lagi penduduk, dengan beberapa di antara mereka menghubungi polis.
Anggota paramedik membawa Tham ke Hospital Besar Ng Teng Fong, di mana dia meninggal dunia akibat kecederaannya sekitar pukul 1.30 pagi pada 17 Februari 2021.
Laporan bedah siasat menunjukkan Tham mengalami sekurang-kurangnya 19 luka tikaman dan 10 luka kelar selain patah tiga tulang rusuk.
Zheng diberkas para pegawai polis dan sampel darahnya diambil. Menurut dokumen mahkamah, lelaki itu dalam keadaan mabuk alkohol akut ketika melakukan kesalahan.
Tertuduh dinilai di Institut Kesihatan Mental (IMH) dan didiagnos dengan gangguan kemurungan yang teruk.
Atas kesalahan membunuh tanpa niat yang tidak membawa kepada pembunuhan, Zheng boleh dikenakan hukuman penjara seumur hidup dan dirotan, atau dipenjara sehingga 20 tahun, didenda atau dirotan.

documents.title: 12 years' jail for man who fatally stabbed ex-girlfriend in Jurong East

sentences.content: SINGAPORE - After a few failed attempts to salvage his relationship with his former girlfriend, an intoxicated man armed himself with a knife and waited for her near her home.
When he spotted the woman, Zheng Xianfeng confronted her in anger and repeatedly stabbed her in the chest and abdomen.
He did not stop even after a passer-by riding a personal mobility device rammed him.

The Chinese national was originally charged with murder, but the charge was reduced as he was assessed to be suffering from major depressive disorder, which diminished his responsibility for his actions.
Four other charges were taken into consideration: One for hurting Ms Tham with a penknife three months prior to the killing, two for hurting his brother, and one for causing annoyance when drunk.
The court heard that Zheng met Ms Tham, a Malaysian, in December 2018 as they rented separate rooms in the same unit and entered into a relationship with her.
Zheng, who was married at the time, was also in a relationship with another woman.
Ms Tham was separated from her husband and had four children living in Malaysia.
Zheng eventually divorced his wife and ended the other relationship.
He shared a room with Ms Tham from September 2019 to November 2020.
He then made several attempts to patch up the relationship.
Once, he smashed Ms Tham's phone and slapped her arm after discovering that she had exchanged messages with a man.
On another occasion, he went to her workplace reeking of alcohol but her manager warned Zheng not to harass her.
When he received a text message from the victim telling him not to harass her again, he became upset and replied saying he felt unhappy and lonely.
Zheng then left home with a knife tucked behind his back and bought snacks and alcohol.
At about 10pm, he went to the void deck of Ms Tham's block and waited for her while continuing to drink.
Close to midnight, Zheng saw her near Block 308 and quickly walked towards her.
A youth, who was hanging out at the void deck of Block 309, alerted two of his friends and called the police after he saw Zheng approaching the woman.
As Zheng approached Ms Tham, she backed away from him until she reached the basketball court near Block 308.
Recalling the unhappy moments in their relationship, Zheng took the knife from his back and started stabbing the victim, who fell to the ground in shock.
One of the youths rammed his PMD into Zheng, but he continued stabbing the victim.
The victim's screams attracted the attention of residents, and at least five other calls were made to the police.
As Zheng fled from the scene, he cut himself twice on his left forearm and passed out on a grass patch near Block 307 .
One of the youths applied pressure to the victim's neck while waiting for the paramedics to arrive.
The victim did not have a pulse when she was taken to Ng Teng Fong General Hospital and resuscitation efforts failed.

On Wednesday, Deputy Public Prosecutor Teo Lu Jia sought 10 to 12 years' jail, given the accused's intent to kill the deceased, and the nature and gravity of the offence which caused significant public disquiet.
She noted that the attack was vicious and unrelenting, that Zheng has violence-related charges, and that Zheng had reoffended while on bail.
Defence counsel Leo Cheng Suan asked for eight to 10 years' jail.
He said his client would like to apologise to the victim's family and intends to pay respects to her remains after his release from prison.

documents.title: Man who stabbed ex-girlfriend to death in Jurong East gets jail

sentences.content: SINGAPORE: A 37-year-old man was sentenced to 12 years' jail on Wednesday (Sep 21) after he stabbed his ex-girlfriend to death in Jurong East in February last year.

Zheng Xianfeng attacked his ex-girlfriend Tham Mee Yoke and continued swinging his knife at her even though a passer-by rode a personal mobility device (PMD) into him in an attempt to stop the assault.
Tham died of her injuries after she was taken to hospital.
Zheng, a Chinese national, was jailed on Wednesday after he pleaded guilty to one count of culpable homicide not amounting to the murder of Tham.
Zheng and Tham first met as flatmates in December 2018 and they began dating after a dinner gathering.
On the morning of Feb 16, 2021, Zheng took leave from work as he was thinking about his ongoing court cases and his relationship issues.
He headed home at noon and started drinking beer.
He received a message from Tham, telling him not to harass her in the future.
At around 10pm, he went to a residents' corner near the victim's residence and resumed drinking while waiting for her.
The victim arrived at the void deck of Block 308, Jurong East Street 32, near midnight.
Tham raised her hands while backing away from Zheng.
He then took out the knife and began stabbing her multiple times in the chest and abdomen.
Tham's screams caught the attention of six other residents, some of whom called the police.
He then removed his clothes and passed out on a grass patch near Block 307, Jurong East Street 32.
One of the three men gave chase but lost sight of Zheng.
Another man, who was training as a nurse, applied pressure on Tham's neck.
Paramedics took Tham to Ng Teng Fong General Hospital, where she died of her injuries at about 1.30am on Feb 17, 2021.
An autopsy report showed she suffered at least 19 stab wounds and 10 incised wounds, along with three rib fractures.
Zheng was arrested by police officers and a blood sample was taken from him.
According to court documents, he was in a state of acute alcohol intoxication at the time of the offence.
The man was assessed at the Institute of Mental Health and diagnosed with major depressive disorder.
The major depressive disorder and acute alcohol intoxication did not compromise Zheng's awareness that his actions were morally and legally wrong, according to court documents.
He was also aware of the "nature, quality and wrongness" of his actions, the documents added.

silver_truth: On February 16, 2021, Zheng Xianfeng, a 37-year-old Chinese national, fatally stabbed his ex-girlfriend, Malaysian citizen Tham Mee Yoke, at the void deck of Block 308 Jurong East Street 32, Singapore. Zheng, intoxicated and distraught over their failed relationship, had waited for Tham while consuming alcohol. When she arrived around midnight, he attacked her with a 26.5cm knife, inflicting multiple stab wounds to her chest and abdomen. Despite a passerby's attempt to intervene, Tham succumbed to her injuries at Ng Teng Fong General Hospital at around 1:30 am on February 17, 2021. Zheng, diagnosed with major depressive disorder, was sentenced to 12 years in jail on September 21, 2022, after pleading guilty to culpable homicide not amounting to murder.

documents.title: Tarikh akhir bagi syarikat laksana tangguh kerja keselamatan dilanjut

sentences.content: SYARIKAT dalam sektor berisiko tinggi di sini akan diberi lebih banyak masa untuk menyemak prosedur keselamatan, dengan tempoh tangguh kerja keselamatan dilanjut hingga 30 September.
Kementerian Tenaga Manusia (MOM) sebelum ini berkata syarikat-syarikat ini diwajibkan melaksanakan tempoh tangguh kerja keselamatan mandatori dari 1 September hingga 15 September.

Syarikat-syarikat ini perlu melengkapkan senarai aktiviti tempoh tangguh keselamatan sebelum tarikh akhir baru itu berlalu sebagai sebahagian keperluan keselamatan tempat kerja dipertingkat yang dikenakan ke atas mereka oleh MOM.

Ini menjejas semua syarikat dalam industri pembinaan, pembuatan, marin, proses, dan pengangkutan dan penyimpanan, serta dalam industri lain yang menggunakan kenderaan berat atau kenderaan industri seperti lori dan forklift.
MOM telah mewajibkan tempoh keselamatan dipertingkat selama enam bulan bagi syarikat di tengah-tengah peningkatan kes kematian dan kecederaan berkaitan kerja di sini.

Dalam satu kenyataan semalam, MOM berkata: "MOM dan Majlis Keselamatan dan Kesihatan Di Tempat Kerja (WSHC) telah menerima maklum balas bahawa industri menyokong langkah-langkah keselamatan dipertingkat tetapi memerlukan lebih banyak masa untuk mematuhi tempoh tangguh kerja keselamatan mandatori, untuk melaksana semakan menyeluruh prosedur keselamatan mereka."
Oleh itu, tarikh akhir untuk menyiapkan tempoh tangguh kerja keselamatan dilanjutkan kepada 30 September.
Selepas tarikh itu MOM akan menjalankan semakan pematuhan dan mengambil tindakan untuk menghalang syarikat beroperasi sekiranya belum menyiapkannya.
Kementerian itu enggan menyatakan berapa banyak syarikat telah menjalankan tempoh tangguh kerja keselamatan setakat ini.
Perubahan ini berlaku memandangkan kematian dan kecederaan berkaitan kerja semakin meningkat.
Terdapat 37 kematian di tempat kerja setakat ini dalam tahun ini, sama seperti jumlah keseluruhan tahun lalu.
Pada Mei, syarikat di sini digesa melaksana tempoh tangguh kerja keselamatan berikutan 10 kemalangan maut di tempat kerja pada April, tetapi ini dilakukan secara sukarela.
"Keselamatan adalah keutamaan kami dan MOM akan bekerjasama dengan industri untuk membangunkan tempat kerja lebih selamat," kata kementerian itu.
Syarikat boleh merujuk kepada senarai semakantempoh tangguh kerja keselamatan di go.gov.sg/stochecklist.

documents.title: Tarikh akhir semak prosedur keselamatan dilanjutkan hingga 30 Sep

sentences.content: SINGAPURA: Kementerian Tenaga Manusia (MOM) memberikan syarikat-syarikat 15 hari lagi untuk menyemak prosedur-prosedur keselamatan yang diwajibkan selepas menerima maklum balas bahawa lebih banyak masa diperlukan untuk berbuat demikian.

Ini melanjutkan tarikh akhir dari 30 September sehingga 1 Oktober, dengan MOM akan menjalankan pemeriksaan pematuhan dan akan mengambil tindakan menggantung kerja terhadap syarikat-syarikat yang didapati belum selesai melaksanakan semakan yang diwajibkan itu, menurut MOM dalam catatannya di Facebook.

MOM mengumumkan pada awal bulan ini bahawa syarikat-syarikat lebih berisiko dikehendaki melaksanakan semakan pada prosedur-prosedur keselamatan mereka bagi meneliti dan menyemak amalan masing-masing dari 1 September hingga 15 September sebagai sebahagian daripada langkah-langkah yang diperkenalkan di bawah tempoh semakan itu.
Syarikat-syarikat yang gagal berbuat demikian akan dilarang daripada menggajikan pekerja hijrahan baru selama sebulan. Ia adalah kali pertama semakan seumpama itu dikuatkuasakan.

Syarat-syarat dan peraturan-peraturan itu dikuatkuasakan ke atas semua syarikat dalam industri binaan, pengilangan, marin, pemprosesan atau pengangkutan serta industri penyimpanan dan industri yang menggunakan kenderaan berat.

MOM menyatakan pada Rabu (21 Sep) bahawa kementerian tersebut dan Majlis Keselamatan dan Kesihatan di Tempat Kerja (WSHC) menerima maklum balas yang menunjukkan industri-industri berkenaan menyokong langkah-langkah keselamatan yang dipertingkat tetapi memerlukan lebih masa untuk mematuhi syarat-syarat yang ditetapkan untuk menjalankan semakan yang teliti ke atas amalan-amalan keselamatan masing-masing.

documents.title: Safety time-out deadline for firms in high-risk sectors extended to Sept 30: MOM

sentences.content: SINGAPORE - Companies in high-risk sectors here will get more time to review their safety procedures with the extension of a safety time-out to Sept 30.
The Ministry of Manpower (MOM) had previously said these companies were required to conduct a mandatory safety time-out from Sept 1 to Sept 15.
MOM has mandated a six-month heightened safety period for companies amid a rise in work-related deaths and injuries here.

In a statement on Wednesday, MOM said: "MOM and the Workplace Safety and Health Council have received feedback that industries are supportive of the heightened safety measures but would require more time to comply with the mandatory safety time-out, to carry out a thorough review of their safety procedures."

Hence, the deadline for completion of the safety time-out will be extended to Sept 30, after which date the MOM will conduct compliance checks and take debarment actions against companies that have not completed it.
The ministry declined to say how many companies have conducted the safety time-out so far.
In May, companies here were urged to take a safety time-out following 10 fatal workplace accidents in April, but this was done on a voluntary basis.
"Safety is our priority and MOM will partner the industries to build safer workplaces," said the ministry.
Companies can refer to the safety time-out checklist at go.gov.sg/stochecklist

documents.title: Safety-time out period to address spate of workplace fatalities extended to end of Sept: MOM

sentences.content: SINGAPORE — As part of moves to address the recent spate of workplace fatalities, the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) will give companies in high-risk sectors 15 more days to review their safety procedures, after receiving feedback from the firms that they need more time to do so.

Said the ministry in a Facebook post on Wednesday (Sept 21): "MOM and the Workplace Safety and Health Council have received feedback that industries are supportive of the heightened safety measures but would require more time to comply with the mandatory safety time-out, to carry out a thorough review of their safety procedures."

The safety time-out process, which gives firms time to review their safety procedures and complete activities required by MOM, was initially slated to be from Sept 1 to 15, but will now be extended until Sept 30, the ministry added.
"Thereafter, from Oct 1, we will conduct compliance checks and will take debarment actions against companies found to have not completed their safety time-out."
The time-out will apply to firms in high-risk sectors, such as those in construction, manufacturing, marine, process, and transportation and storage.

These companies have been issued with a circular and a safety time-out checklist by MOM and they have to follow the items listed out in the checklist, such as requiring top management to do a walkabout on worksites to encourage workers to report safety risks and to share learning points from recent fatal incidents.
Companies will have to show documentary proof of having completed the checklist when MOM officers visit them for routine inspections or investigations.
These are among MOM's measures to address the issue of workplace safety, following the recent spate of workplace fatalities.
Earlier this month, MOM had also imposed a six-month "heightened safety" period.

From Sept 1 to Feb 28 next year, a company may be barred from hiring new foreign employees for up to three months if it was found to have serious workplace safety and health breaches, such as unsafe workplace conditions or poor risk controls, after a serious or fatal workplace accident.
There have been 37 workplace deaths so far this year, the same number as for the whole of last year.
TODAY has asked MOM for the proportion of companies in high-risk sectors that have completed their safety time-out, as well as the number of bosses who have been summoned by MOM.

silver_truth: On September 21, 2022, the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) in Singapore announced an extension of the mandatory safety time-out for companies in high-risk sectors, including construction, manufacturing, marine, process, transportation, and storage. Initially set from September 1 to September 15, the deadline has been pushed to September 30, after receiving feedback from industries that they needed more time to thoroughly review and comply with heightened safety procedures. This extension aims to address the recent rise in work-related fatalities and injuries, with 37 workplace deaths reported so far in 2022, matching the total number for the entire previous year.

documents.title: Wanita yang tikam dirinya di luar sekolah didakwa memiliki 2 senjata

sentences.content: SEORANG wanita yang menikam diri sendiri  di bahagian perut di luar Sekolah Menengah St Hilda di Tampines semasa berdepan dengan polis telah pada Rabu (21 Sep) didakwa memiliki dua senjata.
Juliana Abdul Kadir, 53 tahun, didakwa memiliki  pisau sepanjang 21 sentimeter (cm) dan sebilah pisau lagi berukuran kira-kira 13cm di luar sekolah itu pada petang Isnin.(19 Sep)
Polis sebelum ini berkata mereka dimaklumkan mengenai kejadian itu kira-kira  6.30 petang pada hari itu.
Dalam video yang disiarkan dalam talian, sekurang-kurangnya 10 pegawai polis  dilihat mengelilingi  wanita itu di luar sekolah tersebut.
Polis berkata: “Wanita itu tidak bekerjasama dan enggan mematuhi arahan polis.
“Wanita itu kemudian menikam dirinya di perut dan mengancam untuk mencederakan dirinya lagi.”
Seorang pegawai kemudian menggunakan alat renjat (taser) untuk mengelakkan kecederaan diri.
Pasukan Pertahanan Awam Singapura dimaklumkan kira-kira 6.50 petang. Wanita itu dalam keadaan sedar ketika dibawa ke Hospital Besar Changi.
Polis tidak mendedahkan butiran mengenai kecederaannya.
Semalam, mahkamah mendengar bahawa Juliana akan direman bagi pemerhatian psikiatri. Kesnya  ditangguhkan kepada 12 Oktober.
Atas kesalahan  memiliki senjata, pesalah boleh dipenjara sehingga tiga tahun dan menerima sekurang-kurangnya enam kali rotan.
Lelaki berumur lebih 50 tahun dan wanita tidak boleh dirotan.

documents.gpt_event_labels: The main events that can represent the article are as follows:

documents.title: Wanita tikam diri sendiri ketika bertelagah dengan polis didakwa, direman

sentences.content: SINGAPURA: Seorang wanita yang menikam dirinya sendiri semasa bertelagah dengan polis di luar Sekolah Menengah St Hilda's didakwa pada Rabu (21 Sep).

Warga Singapura, Juliana Abdul Kadir, 53 tahun, dikenakan satu tuduhan memiliki senjata serangan - pisau sepanjang kira-kira 21 sentimeter (cm) dan pisau lipat sekitar 13cm - tanpa tujuan yang sah ketika berada di luar sekolah berkenaan pada Isnin (19 Sep).
Polis dikerahkan ke tempat kejadian di Tampines Street 82 pada pukul 6.30 petang.
Apabila pegawai polis tiba di tempat kejadian, Juliana tidak memberikan kerjasama dan enggan mematuhi arahan polis, menurut polis pada Isnin (19 Sep).

"Wanita itu kemudian menikam dirinya sendiri di bahagian perut dan mengugut untuk mencederakan dirinya lanjut. Demi keselamatannya, seorang pegawai polis kemudian menggunakan senjata renjat untuk mencegah wanita itu daripada terus mencederakan dirinya," tambah polis.
Wanita itu kemudian diberkas kerana memiliki senjata berbahaya dan disyaki melakukan kesalahan berkaitan dengan dadah. Dia juga ditahan di bawah Akta Kesihatan Mental (Penjagaan dan Rawatan).
Juliana kemudian dibawa ke hospital dalam keadaan sedar dan stabil.
Dia direman untuk pemerhatian psikiatrik dan akan kembali untuk perbicaraan seterusnya pada 12 Oktober.

Jika didapati bersalah memiliki senjata serangan tanpa kuasa yang sah, Juliana boleh dipenjara sehingga tiga tahun. Dia bagaimanapun tidak boleh dikenakan hukuman rotan memandangan dia seorang wanita.

documents.title: Woman who stabbed herself outside school charged with possession of 2 weapons

sentences.content: SINGAPORE - A woman who stabbed herself in the abdomen outside St Hilda's Secondary School in Tampines during a stand-off with police was on Wednesday charged with the possession of two weapons.
Juliana Abdul Kadir, 53, allegedly had in her possession a 21cm-long knife and a penknife blade measuring about 13cm outside the school on Monday evening.
Police had earlier said they were alerted to the incident at around 6.30pm that day.
In videos posted online, at least 10 police officers could be seen surrounding a woman outside the school.
Passers-by were also seen observing the commotion while a police officer was directing traffic along a nearby road.
The police had said: "The woman was uncooperative and refused to comply with police's instructions.
"The woman then stabbed herself in the abdomen and threatened to further harm herself."
An officer then tasered her to prevent further self-harm.
The police did not disclose details about her injuries.
On Wednesday, the court heard that Juliana will be remanded for psychiatric observation.
Her case has been adjourned to Oct 12.
For being in possession of weapons, an offender can be jailed for up to three years and receive at least six stokes of the cane.
Men over 50 years old and women cannot be caned.

documents.title: Woman who stabbed herself during police stand-off in Tampines charged, remanded for psychiatric observation

sentences.content: SINGAPORE: A woman who stabbed herself during a stand-off with police outside St Hilda's Secondary School was charged on Wednesday (Sep 21).
When officers arrived at the scene, Juliana was uncooperative and refused to comply with the police’s instructions, the police had said on Monday.
"The woman then stabbed herself in the abdomen and threatened to further harm herself.
For her safety, one of the police officers then discharged a Taser to prevent the woman from further injuring herself," the police added.

silver_truth: On the evening of September 19, 2022, Juliana Abdul Kadir, a 53-year-old Singaporean woman, was involved in a stand-off with police outside St Hilda's Secondary School in Tampines, Singapore. The police were alerted to the incident at around 6:30 PM. Upon arrival, officers found Juliana uncooperative and refusing to comply with their instructions. During the confrontation, she stabbed herself in the abdomen and threatened further self-harm. To prevent her from causing more injury to herself, a police officer used a Taser on her. Juliana was subsequently arrested for possessing two weapons: a 21cm-long knife and a 13cm penknife blade. She was also suspected of drug-related offenses and detained under the Mental Health (Care and Treatment) Act. The Singapore Civil Defence Force was notified at approximately 6:50 PM, and she was taken to Changi General Hospital in a conscious and stable condition. On September 21, Juliana was charged with possessing dangerous weapons and was remanded for psychiatric observation. Her case is scheduled for a further hearing on October 12. If convicted, she faces up to three years in prison, although she cannot be caned due to her gender.

documents.title: 指南草案称：医生应该对65岁以下的美国人进行焦虑症筛查

sentences.content: 根据美国预防服务工作组（USPSTF）2022年9月20日发布的指南草案，65岁以下的美国人应接受焦虑症筛查 1 。
该工作组此前曾建议对包括孕产妇在内的所有成年人进行抑郁症筛查，并对8~18岁的青少年进行焦虑症筛查。该工作组还表示没有足够的证据支持或反对对所有成年人进行自杀风险筛查，或对65岁以上人群进行焦虑症筛查。
工作组强调，这些建议只适用于还未被识别出焦虑或抑郁迹象或症状的人群。
这些建议将在10月17日前公开征求公众意见，并最终确定下来。
该工作组是独立志愿小组，由美国预防和循证医学领域的国家级专家组成，通过为临床预防服务提供建议，以改善美国人民的健康。
该工作组在声明中表示："焦虑、抑郁以及自杀想法或行为都是心理健康问题，影响美国许多成年人的生活。焦虑症表现为多种形式，包括广泛性焦虑障碍和社交焦虑，但所有表现的特点都是过度恐惧或担忧。抑郁症，又称重度抑郁障碍，是一种会对人的感觉、思考和行为产生负面影响的疾病。"
世界卫生组织（WHO）3月报告称，在新型冠状病毒肺炎（简称新冠）疫情的第一年，全球焦虑症及抑郁症患病率增长了25%。WHO总干事谭德塞（Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus）称："关于新冠对人类心理健康的影响，我们目前获得的信息只是冰山一角。这给各国敲响了警钟，应该更关注公民的心理健康，并提供更多的支持 2 。"
该工作组成员、临床心理学家、马萨诸塞大学医学院（University of Massachusetts Chan Medical School）教授Lori Pbert表示，对所有成年人进行抑郁症筛查"有助于及早发现问题，让大家能够得到治疗"。
该工作组表示，筛查以及后续治疗可减轻焦虑和抑郁症状，但筛查只是第一步。筛查结果阳性人群需接受进一步评估，以确定他们是否患有焦虑症或抑郁症。确诊后，他们应参与医护人员共同决策，以确定对其健康有益的单一或联合治疗，并接受监测，确保治疗有效。
目前，医生们需要做的筛查已有很长一个名单，这些新的建议将会被列入其中。
就该拟定的建议，The BMJ向拥有约16万名成员的美国内科医师学会（American College of Physicians）征求意见，但该学会拒绝置评。

拥有约127 600名成员的美国家庭医师学会（AAFP）表示："家庭医师学会理解在初级医疗机构整合心理健康筛查和治疗的迫切需求。AAFP目前正在审查USPSTF最新版焦虑症和更新版抑郁症筛查指南草案，旨在推动实现这一整合目标。AAFP公众健康和科学委员会（Commission on the Health of the Public and Science）将审查草案证据报告和建议语言，以确定应提交哪些意见（如果有）作为答复。在USPSTF的最终建议发布后，AAFP将再次对其审查，以确定应该支持该拟定的建议，还是提出自己的建议。"

documents.title: US health panel recommends anxiety screening for all adults younger than 65

sentences.content: NEW YORK - A panel of medical experts Tuesday recommended for the first time that doctors screen all adult patients younger than 65 for anxiety, guidance that highlights the extraordinary stress levels that have plagued the United States since the start of the pandemic.
The advisory group, called the US Preventive Services Task Force, said the guidance was intended to help prevent mental health disorders from going undetected and untreated for years or even decades.
It made a similar recommendation for children and teenagers earlier this year.
The panel, appointed by an arm of the federal Department of Health and Human Services, has been preparing the guidance since before the pandemic.
The recommendations come at a time of "critical need," said Dr Lori Pbert, a clinical psychologist and professor at the University of Massachusetts Chan Medical School, who serves on the task force.
Americans have been reporting outsize anxiety levels in response to a confluence of stressors, including inflation and crime rates, fear of illness and loss of loved ones from Covid-19.
"It's a crisis in this country," Dr Pbert said.
"Our only hope is that our recommendations throw a spotlight on the need to create greater access to mental health care - and urgently."

From August 2020 to February 2021, the percentage of adults with recent symptoms of an anxiety or a depressive disorder increased from 36.4 per cent to 41.5 per cent, according to one study cited by the task force.
The guidance was issued in draft form.
The panel will finalise it in the coming months after reviewing public comments.
While the panel's recommendations are not compulsory, they heavily influence the standard of care among primary care physicians across the country.
In response to the recommendations, mental health care providers emphasised that screening programmes are useful only if they lead patients to effective solutions.

At a time when the country is "short on mental health resources on all levels - psychiatrists, psychologists and therapists - that's a real concern," said Dr Jeffrey Staab, a psychiatrist and chair of the department of psychiatry and psychology at Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota.
"We can screen lots of people, but if that's all that happens, it's a waste of time," said Dr Staab, who is not on the task force.

Psychiatrists, while pleased with the attention on mental health, also underscored that a standardised screening is only the first step toward a diagnosis, and that providers will need to guard against assuming that a positive screening result indicates a clinical disorder.
For many Americans, the screening could simply reveal a temporary period of distress and a need for extra support.
"When providers say, 'You must have a disorder, here, take this,' we could face an over-prescribing problem," Dr Staab said.
"But the opposite scenario is that we have lots of people suffering who shouldn't be.
Both outcomes are possible."
Rising mental health issues are not unique to the United States.
Anxiety and depression increased by 25 per cent globally during the first year of the pandemic, according to the World Health Organisation, and has only partially improved since.
About one-quarter of men and about 40 per cent of women in the United States face an anxiety disorder in their lifetimes, according to the task force, although much of the data is outdated.
Women have nearly double the risk of depression compared with men, studies show, and the recommendation paid special attention to screenings for pregnant and postpartum patients.
Physicians typically use questionnaires and scales to survey for mental health disorders.
According to the recommendations, positive screening results would lead to additional assessments at the provider's discretion, depending on underlying health conditions and other life events.
Some primary care physicians expressed concern that adding an additional responsibility to their wide-ranging checklist for brief patient appointments is implausible.
Dr Pbert said that those providers should "do what they already do on a daily basis: Juggle and prioritise."

She also said the task force's rigorous review of available studies revealed that people of colour are often underrepresented in mental health research, which, if not addressed, could contribute to a cycle of inequity.

Mental health disparities are rampant in the United States, where Black patients are less likely to be treated for mental health conditions than are white patients, and Black and Hispanic patients are both more frequently misdiagnosed.
From 2014 to 2019, the suicide rate among Black Americans increased by 30 per cent, data shows.
Standardising screening for all patients could help combat the effects of racism, implicit bias and other systemic issues in the medical field, Dr Pbert said.
The task force panel did not extend its screening recommendations to patients 65 and older.

It said there was no clear evidence regarding the effectiveness of screening tools in older adults because anxiety symptoms are similar to normal signs of ageing, such as fatigue and generalised pain.
The panel also said it lacked evidence on whether depression screening among adults who do not show clear signs of the disorder would ultimately prevent suicides.
The task force will accept public comments on the draft recommendation through Oct 17.
NYTIMES

documents.title: US adults should get routine anxiety screening, panel says

sentences.content: US doctors should regularly screen all adults under 65 for anxiety, an influential health guidelines group proposed Tuesday (Sep 20).
It’s the first time the US Preventive Services Task Force has recommended anxiety screening in primary care for adults without symptoms.
The proposal is open for public comment until Oct 17, but the group usually affirms its draft guidance.
The recommendations are based on a review that began before the COVID-19 pandemic, evaluating studies showing potential benefits and risks from screening.
Given reports of a surge in mental health problems linked with pandemic isolation and stress, the guidance is "very timely", said Lori Pbert, a task force member and co-author.
Pbert is a psychologist-researcher at the University of Massachusetts’ Chan Medical School.
The task force said evidence for benefits, including effective treatments, outweighs any risks, which include inaccurate screening results that could lead to unnecessary follow-up care.
Anxiety disorders are among the most common mental health complaints, affecting about 40 per cent of US women at some point in their lives and more than 1 in 4 men, Pbert noted.

Black people, those living in poverty, people who have lost partners and those who have other mental health issues are among adults who face higher risks for developing anxiety, which can manifest as panic attacks, phobias or feeling always on edge.
Also, about 1 in 10 pregnant and postpartum women experience anxiety.
Common screening tools include brief questionnaires about symptoms such as fears and worries that interfere with usual activities.
These can easily be given in a primary care setting, the task force said, although it didn’t specify how often patients should be screened.
“The most important thing to recognize is that a screening test alone is not sufficient to diagnose anxiety," Pbert said.
The next step is a more thorough evaluation by a mental health professional, though Pbert acknowledged that finding mental health care can be difficult given shortages of specialists.
Megan Whalen, a 31-year-old marketing specialist who was diagnosed with anxiety in 2013, says regular doctors should screen for mental health issues as commonly as they do for physical problems.
“Health is health, whether the problem is visible or not," said Whalen, of Hoboken, New Jersey.
She has gotten help from medicine and talk therapy, but her symptoms worsened during the pandemic and she temporarily moved back home.
“The pandemic made me afraid to leave home, my anxiety telling me anywhere outside of my childhood house was unsafe," Whelan said.
“I absolutely still struggle with feelings of dread and fear sometimes.
It’s just a part of my life at this point, and I try to manage it as best as I can."
The task force said there isn’t enough solid research in older adults to recommend for or against anxiety screening in those aged 65 and up.

The group continues to recommend depression screening for adults and children, but said there isn’t enough evidence to evaluate potential benefits and harms of suicide screening in adults who show no worrisome symptoms.

In April, the group issued similar draft guidance for children and teens, recommending anxiety screening but stating that more research is needed on potential benefits and harms of suicide screening kids with no obvious signs.
Guidelines from the task force often determine insurance coverage, but anxiety is already on the radar of many primary care doctors.
In 2020, a group affiliated with the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists recommended routine primary care anxiety screening for women and girls starting at age 13.
Melissa Lewis-Duarte, a wellness coach in Scottsdale, Arizona, says rhythmic breathing, meditation and making a daily list of three things for which she is grateful have all helped with her anxiety.
“Doctors say, ‘Make sure you’re sleeping, control your stress.’ Yeah, I get that," but not everyone knows how, said the 42-year-old mother of three.
“It’s difficult to prioritise self-care, but that’s what’s necessary.”

silver_truth: On September 20, 2022, the US Preventive Services Task Force (USPSTF) proposed that doctors should screen all American adults under the age of 65 for anxiety. This is the first time such a recommendation has been made for adults without symptoms. The proposal, open for public comment until October 17, aims to detect and treat mental health disorders early. The task force emphasized that screening should be followed by thorough evaluations and appropriate treatments, noting the surge in mental health issues due to pandemic-related stressors like isolation, fear of illness, and economic challenges.

documents.title: Peguam didakwa dalam kes langgar lari sebabkan penunggang motosikal cedera serius

sentences.content: SEORANG peguam telah diheret ke Mahkamah Daerah semalam selepas didakwa terlibat dalam kemalangan langgar lari yang mengakibatkan seorang penunggang motosikal mengalami kecederaan serius.

Gregory John Fong Mun Yung, 49 tahun, daripada firma guaman Fong & Fong, menghadapi tiga tuduhan, termasuk menyebabkan kecederaan parah semasa memandu dengan cara yang membahayakan orang awam dan gagal berhenti selepas kemalangan.

Satu carian yang dibuat akhbar The Straits Times di laman web Kementerian Undang-Undang menunjukkan Fong adalah pengarah di firma itu, manakala carian di laman Penguasa Pengawalan Perakaunan dan Korporat pula menunjukkan bahawa dia seorang pengurus dan rakan kongsi di Beston Law.
Fong didakwa memandu kereta di sepanjang Ekspreswe Kallang-Paya Lebar menghala ke Ekspreswe Tampines sekitar 6 petang pada 13 Jun 2021 apabila nahas dengan motosikal itu berlaku.
Mangsa berusia 42 tahun itu mengalami kecederaan teruk, namun tidak didedahkan dalam dokumen mahkamah.
Fong dituduh gagal berhenti selepas nahas itu dan juga dikatakan telah meninggalkan tempat kejadian tanpa menghulurkan sebarang bantuan.
Kes itu telah ditangguhkan kepada 12 Oktober.
Pesalah kami pertama yang menyebabkan kecederaan ke orang lain semasa memandu dengan cara yang membahayakan orang awam boleh dijatuhi hukuman penjara antara satu dengan lima tahun.
Pesalah berulang boleh dihukum antara dua dengan 10 tahun.
Oleh kerana gagal berhenti selepas kemalangan, pesalah kali pertama boleh dipenjara hingga tiga bulan dan didenda hingga $1,000.
Pesalah berulang boleh dihukum penjara hingga enam bulan dan didenda hingga $2,000.

documents.title: Lawyer charged over hit-and-run accident that injured biker

sentences.content: SINGAPORE - A lawyer was hauled to a district court on Wednesday after he was allegedly involved in a hit-and-run accident in which a motorcyclist suffered serious injuries.

Gregory John Fong Mun Yung, 49, who is from Fong & Fong law firm, faces three charges, including one count each of causing grievous hurt while driving in a manner that was dangerous to the public and failing to stop after an accident.
A search on the Ministry of Law's website shows that he is a director at the firm.
Another search with the Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority indicates that he is a manager and partner at Beston Law.
Fong was allegedly driving a car along the Kallang-Paya Lebar Expressway towards Tampines Expressway at around 6pm on June 13, 2021, when a collision occurred with a motorcycle.
The 42-year-old rider suffered serious injuries, but details about them were not stated in court documents.
Fong is accused of failing to stop after the accident.
He is also said to have left the scene without rendering any assistance.
The case has been adjourned to Oct 12.
For causing grievous hurt to another person while driving in a manner that was dangerous to the public, a first-time offender can be jailed for between one and five years.
A repeat offender can be jailed for between two and 10 years.
For failing to stop after an accident, a first-time offender can be jailed for up to three months and fined up to $1,000.
A repeat offender can be jailed for up to six months and fined up to $2,000.

documents.title: Lawyer charged over hit-and-run with motorcyclist who allegedly sustained serious injuries

sentences.content: According to his charge sheet, Fong drove his car in a dangerous manner by overtaking Mr Lee, who was on a motorcycle riding on lane two of the three-lane road along KPE towards Tampines Expressway at 5.56pm.
If convicted of failing to render assistance after a road accident, Fong may be jailed up to three months, fined up to $1,000 on a first offence, or both.

silver_truth: On June 13, 2021, Gregory John Fong Mun Yung, a 49-year-old lawyer from the Fong & Fong law firm, was involved in a hit-and-run accident while driving along the Kallang-Paya Lebar Expressway towards the Tampines Expressway in Singapore. Fong allegedly drove his car in a dangerous manner, overtaking a motorcyclist named Mr. Lee, who was riding on lane two of a three-lane road. The collision resulted in Mr. Lee, aged 42, suffering serious injuries. Fong is accused of failing to stop after the accident and leaving the scene without rendering any assistance. He faces three charges, including causing grievous hurt while driving dangerously and failing to stop after an accident. The case has been adjourned to October 12, 2022. If convicted, Fong could face a prison sentence ranging from one to five years for causing grievous hurt, with repeat offenders facing two to ten years. For failing to stop after an accident, first-time offenders can be jailed for up to three months and fined up to $1,000, while repeat offenders can face up to six months in jail and fines up to $2,000.

documents.title: South Korea early exports edge higher amid weakening global demand

sentences.content: SEOUL - South Korea's early trade data showed exports are only just still growing in September in a sign of fallout from lockdowns in China and a struggling global economy.
Daily shipments advanced 1.8 per cent on average in the first 20 days of the month compared with a year earlier, the Customs office said on Wednesday.
Headline exports dropped 8.7 per cent, led by a 14 per cent decline in shipments to China.
Semiconductor sales still increased by 3.4 per cent.
Exports have slowed in recent months as international demand weakens in response to Russia's war on Ukraine, Covid-19 outbreaks in China and rapid policy tightening by central banks.
The Bank of Korea has been relying on resilient overseas sales to underpin its policy tightening as it seeks to rein in inflation.
Trade deficits are another concern as energy prices remain elevated and the currency weakens to hover around levels last seen during the global financial crisis.
South Korean exports tend to reflect trends in international economic activity with the nation's companies embedded widely across global supply chains, including semiconductor and auto makers.
Technology products, which account for a third of South Korean exports, were among the first to cool as global demand slackened.
They fell 4.6 per cent last month, with semiconductors, smartphones and computers all declining.
BLOOMBERG

documents.title: S Korea 20-day exports fall on holiday effects, slow global economy

sentences.content: SEOUL :     South Korea's exports fell 8.7 per cent in the first 20 days of September from the same period a year earlier due to holiday effects and amid signs of slowing growth in major trading partners, customs agency data showed on Wednesday.
The country's imports for the same 20-day period rose 6.1 per cent, producing a trade deficit of $4.1 billion, the Korea Customs Service data showed.
The poor export performance, compared with positive growth seen in recent months, was due mainly to fewer working days this month than a year because of the Chuseok holidays.
Average exports per working day during the Sept. 1-20 period rose 1.8 per cent from a year before, it added.
Finance Minister Choo Kyung-ho held a meeting of senior government officials to review trade conditions and vowed to focus policy to help exporters.

silver_truth: In September 2022, South Korea's early trade data indicated a slowdown in export growth, reflecting the impact of China's lockdowns and a weakening global economy. According to the Customs office, daily shipments increased by an average of 1.8% in the first 20 days of the month compared to the previous year. However, headline exports dropped by 8.7%, significantly affected by a 14% decline in shipments to China. Despite this, semiconductor sales saw a modest increase of 3.4%. The overall export performance has been sluggish in recent months due to factors such as Russia's war on Ukraine, COVID-19 outbreaks in China, and rapid policy tightening by central banks. The Bank of Korea has been relying on robust overseas sales to control inflation, but trade deficits remain a concern amid high energy prices and a weakening currency. Technology products, which make up a third of South Korean exports, fell by 4.6% last month, with declines in semiconductors, smartphones, and computers. Additionally, the Korea Customs Service reported that South Korea's imports rose by 6.1% in the first 20 days of September, resulting in a trade deficit of $4.1 billion. The poor export performance was attributed to the Chuseok holiday effect, which led to fewer working days. Finance Minister Choo Kyung-ho convened a meeting with senior officials to review trade conditions and pledged to focus policies on aiding exporters.

documents.title: Japan weighs plan for ban on hotel guests without masks to curb Covid-19: Report

sentences.content: TOKYO - Japan's government is considering allowing hotels to refuse entry to guests who do not wear masks and follow other measures to control infection during an outbreak, Fuji News Network said on Wednesday.

The government will submit a bill at an extraordinary session of Parliament in October that would revise the law governing hotels and inns, allowing them more power to enforce infection measures, the network said.
The move would come at a time when Japan is expected to further ease its Covid-19 border controls, waiving visa requirements for certain tourists and removing a limit on daily arrivals.
The ruling Liberal Democratic Party is scheduled to debate border easing measures on Thursday.

Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, who departed on Tuesday for the United Nations General Assembly in New York, may announce the border easing during a speech at the New York Stock Exchange, the Yomiuri newspaper reported.
Currently, the wearing of masks is not compulsory in Japan but is strongly recommended indoors and on public transport.
Anticipating the eighth wave of Covid-19, possibly this winter, the government intends to devise countermeasures as early as October.

One of the key measures involved will be accelerating the administration of new vaccines deemed effective against the Omicron variant, which would prevent people from getting infected with Covid-19 developing severe symptoms.
REUTERS, THE YOMIURI SHIMBUN/ASIA NEWS NETWORK

documents.title: Japan weighs plan for ban on hotel guests without masks: Report

sentences.content: TOKYO: Japan's government is considering allowing hotels to refuse entry to guests who do not wear masks and follow other measures to control infection during an outbreak, Fuji News Network said on Wednesday (Sep 21).

The government will submit a Bill at an extraordinary session of parliament next month that would revise the law governing hotels and inns, allowing them more power to enforce infection measures, the network said.
The move would come at a time when Japan is expected to further ease its COVID-19 border controls, waiving visa requirements for certain tourists and removing a limit on daily arrivals.
The ruling Liberal Democratic Party is scheduled to debate border easing measures on Thursday.

Japanese Prime Minister, who departed on Tuesday for the United Nations General Assembly Meeting, may announce the border easing during a speech at the New York Stock Exchange, the Yomiuri newspaper reported.
Currently, the wearing of masks is not compulsory in Japan but is strongly recommended indoors and on public transport.

silver_truth: In September 2022, the Japanese government considered allowing hotels to refuse entry to guests who do not wear masks and adhere to other infection control measures during outbreaks, as reported by Fuji News Network. To facilitate this, a bill revising the laws governing hotels and inns will be submitted in an extraordinary session of Parliament in October, granting hotels more authority to enforce such measures. This initiative aligns with Japan's anticipated easing of COVID-19 border controls, which includes waiving visa requirements for certain tourists and lifting the daily arrival cap. The ruling Liberal Democratic Party is set to debate these border easing measures on Thursday. Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, who left for the United Nations General Assembly in New York on Tuesday, may announce these changes during a speech at the New York Stock Exchange. Although mask-wearing is not mandatory in Japan, it is strongly recommended indoors and on public transport. In preparation for a potential eighth wave of COVID-19, which could occur in winter, the government aims to implement countermeasures by October, including the expedited administration of new vaccines effective against the Omicron variant to prevent severe infections.

documents.title: SATS pengendali kargo udara terbesar di dunia

sentences.content: SINGAPURA: Syarikat pengendalian lapangan terbang dan penyediaan makanan di dalam pesawat, SATS, bakal menjadi syarikat pengendali kargo udara yang terbesar di dunia.
Ini menyusuli langkahnya hendak membeli syarikat Worldwide Flight Services yang berpangkalan di Paris.
Pembelian secara tunai itu bernilai S$1.6 bilion.
Ia akan membentuk rangkaian kargo udara yang merentasi dua benua, Amerika dan Eropah, serta rantau Asia Pasifik.
Rangkaian itu meliputi lebih 200 pangkalan kargo dan pengendalian di darat di lebih 20 negara.
Gabungan rangkaian tersebut akan meliputi laluan-laluan penerbangan yang merangkumi lebih separuh jumlah kargo udara sedunia.
Menurut SATS, pembelian itu dapat membolehkannya memanfaatkan lagi pertumbuhan rantaian bekalan.
Ini terutamanya dalam segmen permintaan tinggi seperti e-dagang dan ubat-ubatan.
Urus niaga itu dijangka selesai menjelang Mac tahun depan.

documents.title: Sats bakal jadi pengendali kargo udara terbesar dunia

sentences.content: SATS bersetuju membeli pengendali kargo udara terbesar di dunia, Worldwide Flight Services (WFS), pada nilai perusahaan Euro 2.25 bilion ($3.1 bilion), satu langkah yang akan menaikkan firma dalam senarai bursa saham Singapura itu menjadi yang terunggul dalam perkhidmatan penerbangan.

Syarikat katering dalam pesawat dan pengendali darat itu akan membayar sekitar $1.64 bilion dalam bentuk tunai bagi syarikat yang berpangkalan di Paris, menurut Sats kepada bursa saham Singapura, selepas menghentikan dagangan awal pagi semalam.
Rancangan Sats untuk membiayai perjanjian itu menerusi pengumpulan dana ekuiti sebanyak $1.7 bilion dengan bakinya diambil daripada sumber tunai dalaman.

Minggu lalu Sats mengesahkan bahawa ia sedang dalam perbincangan dengan Cerberus Capital Management untuk membeli pengendali kargo udara itu selepas Bloomberg News melaporkan bahawa Sats sedang dalam perbincangan bagi satu potensi perjanjian.
Pembelian yang disarankan itu akan meletakkan Sats sebagai pengendali kargo terbesar di dunia, menguruskan lebih sembilan juta ton kargo, katanya.

Rangkaian yang menggabungkan kededua entiti itu akan meliputi laluan dagangan merangkumi lebih daripada 50 peratus jumlah kargo udara sedunia, dengan hab-hab strategik di Asia, Eropah, dan Amerika Syarikat, serta dalam pasaran membangun yang baru termasuk Latin Amerika dan Afrika.

Diasaskan pada 1984, WFS beroperasi dalam lima daripada 10 lapangan terbang kargo terunggul di Amerika Utara, dan Eropah, Timur Tengah dan Afrika, termasuk Los Angeles, Chicago, Miami, Frankfurt dan Paris.
Sementara itu, Sats sudah pun berada di empat daripada 10 lapangan terbang kargo terunggul di Asia, termasuk Hongkong, Taipei, Singapura dan Beijing.
Para pelanggan Sats inginkan sokongan yang lancar di seluruh wilayah, dalam satu cara yang memudahkan dan mengukuhkan operasi mereka, kata Presiden dan ketua eksekutif Sats, Encik Kerry Mok.

"Bergabung dengan WFS akan membolehkan kami memenuhi keperluan tersebut menerusi huraian dan keupayaan pengendalian kargo yang baru, kualiti perkhidmatan yang dipertingkat, pendigitalan yang lebih hebat dan ketampakan serta penjejakan yang lebih baik dalam rangkaian bekalan keseluruhan," kata Encik Mok.
Pasaran pengendalian kargo sejagat telah membuktikan daya ketahanannya, didorong oleh pertumbuhan e-dagang dan permintaan bagi perkhidmatan khusus seperti farmasi.

Sats akur bahawa usulan perniagaan yang digabungkan itu akan membolehkannya memanfaatkan trend pertumbuhan struktural masa kini di mana pemain e-dagang kian menambah kerjasama dengan pengendali kargo dan pelanggan menjangkakan penyedia khidmat menawarkan huraian bagi menguruskan rantaian bekalan kompleks mereka dan menawarkan hubungan yang lancar.

documents.title: Sats said to be in talks to buy Worldwide Flight Services

sentences.content: SINGAPORE - Catering and gateway services provider Sats is in talks to acquire air cargo handler Worldwide Flight Services, the company confirmed Wednesday.
The Singapore-listed company has sounded out financing for the potential purchase, said the people, who asked not to be identified as the information is private.
An announcement could come as soon as in the coming weeks should the parties reach an agreement, one of the people said.
Trading in Sats shares was halted late Wednesday afternoon after the Bloomberg News report, pending an announcement.
The counter was up three cents or 0.7 per cent to $4.09 before the trading halt.
The 6.375 per cent bonds issued by Worldwide Flight Services via a vehicle jumped by a record 6.7 cent to 91 cents on the euro, according to CBBT pricing compiled by Bloomberg.
The notes were the day’s biggest winners among European junk-rated bonds in early trading.
Any deal will add to a wave of acquisitions betting on the rising demand for logistics services as global travel resumes.
Singapore's PSA International last December agreed to acquire BDP International, a transportation company, from US buyout firm Greenbriar Equity Group.

In a business update for the first quarter ended June 30, 2022, Sats noted that it has been ramping operations and capacity to an anticipated increase in travel and cargo volume, which it expects to continue despite inflationary challenges.
Mr Kerry Mok, president and chief executive of Sats said the company is “focused on capitalising on growth opportunities to broaden our revenue streams”.
The company reported an operating loss of $34.3 million for the April-June quarter.
The last major acquisition made by Sats was in 2009, when it acquired Temasek’s stake in Singapore Food Industries for $334.5 million to expand its in-flight catering service.

BLOOMBERG
• With additional information from The Straits Times

documents.title: SATS says it is in talks to buy air cargo firm Worldwide Flight Services

sentences.content: :Singapore-based ground handling services firm SATS Ltd said on Wednesday it is in talks to buy Paris-based air cargo logistics company Worldwide Flight Services (WFS).
Bloomberg News had reported earlier in the day that SATS had sounded out financing for the potential deal, which could be for about $3 billion.
The in-flight catering services provider, however, flagged that no definitive terms or formal legal documentation have been agreed upon, and that the report contained "materially inaccurate facts".
SATS, which currently has a market capitalization of $3.26 billion, also said discussions concerning the transaction are developing and there is no certainty that it will proceed.
In a separate statement, WFS confirmed talks with SATS for a possible transaction, but did not divulge any details on the deal.
WFS is owned by private equity firm Cerberus Capital Management.
It operates in more than 165 locations across 17 countries, and is the world's biggest air cargo operator, according to the company's website.
Shares in SATS were up 0.7 per cent at S$4.09 on Wednesday, but were halted after the report.

silver_truth: On September 21, 2022, Singapore-based ground handling and in-flight catering services provider SATS Ltd announced its intention to acquire Paris-based air cargo logistics company Worldwide Flight Services (WFS). The acquisition, valued at approximately $3 billion (EUR 2.25 billion or S$1.6 billion), aims to make SATS the largest air cargo handler globally. The deal, which SATS plans to finance through equity fundraising and internal cash resources, is expected to be finalized by March 2023. The combined entity will operate across more than 200 cargo and ground handling bases in over 20 countries, covering major trade routes in Asia, Europe, and the Americas. This merger will enable SATS to manage over nine million tons of cargo annually and leverage growth opportunities in high-demand sectors such as e-commerce and pharmaceuticals. While discussions and financing plans are ongoing, no definitive terms have been set, and the parties involved have acknowledged the uncertainty of the deal proceeding. SATS shares experienced a trading halt following the Bloomberg News report, pending further announcements.

documents.title: Man who drove van along a park connector pavement for 1.2km gets jail

sentences.content: Muhammad Ibrahim Abdullah was also disqualified from holding or obtaining all classes of driving licences for 15 months from his date of release.
Ibrahim had told investigators he was working as a lorry driver from 10.30pm on April 18, 2020, until around 6.30am the next day.
About 90 minutes later, he started on his second job as a van driver, delivering food parcels.
He then stopped at his cousin’s home at 11am for a meal before heading home about an hour later.
As a result, another motorist had to apply the brakes to prevent a collision.
The motorist’s passenger then alighted, approached Ibrahim’s van and knocked on the window.
Ibrahim woke up and when queried, he told the passenger that he was feeling tired and “just wanted to head home”.

Deputy Public Prosecutor Jocelyn Teo said: “Although the accused was aware that he had mounted the kerb along the park connector, he chose not to reverse back onto the road but instead continued driving along the pavement of the park connector for 1.2 km.

“When the accused reached the end of the park connector, (he) came to a stop and a passer-by approached (him).”
The passer-by asked Ibrahim how he was feeling at the time and he replied with slurred speech that he was fine.
The passer-by told Ibrahim to wait for the police.
Instead of complying, Ibrahim proceeded to drive onto a nearby road.
While doing so, the van stuck a railing and a bollard, the court heard.
The police were alerted and officers later tracked down Ibrahim who confirmed that he was driving the van during the incident.
DPP Teo said: “It was only fortuitous that there were no pedestrians walking along the park connector at that time, and there was thankfully no personal injury caused.”

documents.title: Driver who beat red light, drove along pavement of park connector for 1.2km jailed

sentences.content: He knocked on the driver's window and Ibrahim woke up.
For driving in a rash manner to endanger human life, Ibrahim could have been jailed up to a year, or fined up to S$5,000, or both.

silver_truth: On April 18, 2020, Muhammad Ibrahim Abdullah worked as a lorry driver from 10:30pm until 6:30am the next day. He then started a second job as a van driver, delivering food parcels. Around 12:30pm on April 19, an exhausted Ibrahim fell asleep at the wheel at a junction at Ang Mo Kio Avenue 5, running a red light and mounting a kerb. This forced another motorist to brake to avoid a collision. The motorist's passenger approached Ibrahim's van, knocked on the window, and woke him up. Ibrahim admitted he was tired and intended to head home. Despite being advised by a passer-by to wait for the police, Ibrahim continued driving, damaging a railing and a bollard. He was later tracked down by the police and confirmed he was driving during the incident. On September 21, 2022, Ibrahim was sentenced to six days in jail for driving in a rash manner that endangered human life. He was also disqualified from holding or obtaining all classes of driving licences for 15 months.

documents.title: Health Check Podcast: Take charge of your health with Healthier SG

sentences.content: Synopsis: Every first and third Wednesday of the month, The Straits Times helps you make sense of health matters that affect you.
A white paper on the new national preventive care strategy known as Healthier SG is out.
The Ministry of Health has submitted it to Parliament and it will be debated in October 2022.
The plan is to launch it in the second half of 2023, when those aged 60 and above will be invited to enrol with a primary care clinic.
In the next two years following that, those aged 40-59 will be invited to do so.
With Healthier SG, the government will place greater emphasis on preventive care than on sick care.
It’s a major transformation of the healthcare system, driven by capitation funding, that is aimed at helping the rapidly ageing population here to stay healthy longer.

In this episode, ST senior health correspondent Joyce Teo speaks to associate Professor Jeremy Lim, the director of the Leadership Institute for Global Health Transformation at the NUS Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health.

Highlights (click/tap above):
2:20 Critical for family doctors to enrol in system; inertia the biggest enemy for public
3:13 The first cohort of 60 and above: Why drug subsidies to bring GP pricing closer to that of polyclinics will be attractive
6:53 Make better use of Healthier SG care plan, with digital tools healthhub.sg and the Healthy 365 app
9:00 Free nationally-recommended health screenings and vaccinations, including flu jabs, with co-payment benefits resulting in actual cash savings
9:39 Prof Lim on why this is “very real free money” to help individuals live healthier lives, and his personal advice once enrolment opens
Edited by: Eden Soh
